intro: Archytaea alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaf archytaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its alternate leaf arrangement and slender, branched stems. The leaves are typically narrow and have a distinct, often serrated edge. This plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of southern Europe and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
